com.cinchapi.concourse.commitlog

Class CommitLog

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cinchapi.concourse.api.AbstractConcourseService
      • com.cinchapi.concourse.commitlog.CommitLog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Queryable, Retrievable, Revisable, ByteSized, Persistable, IterableByteSequences

    public class CommitLog
extends AbstractConcourseService
implements IterableByteSequences, Persistable

    A log that serves as a temporary store for revisions. The log is memory mapped and append-only to enable fast writes. Be aware that these fast writes may come with the expense of slower reads if the log grows too large because it is not optimized for queries (i.e it does not maintain any index). While not optimized for reads, they all occur in memory.

    Storage

    The size of the CommitLog on disk cannot exceed 2147483647 bytes. In-memory, the CommitLog will take up up to 2x the amount of space that it does on disk.

    Author:
    jnelson

        public void writeTo(java.nio.channels.FileChannel channel)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from interface: Persistable
        Write the object to a writable channel. This method should acquire a lock over the region from the channels current position plus the ByteSized.size() of the value. The caller is responsible for ensuring that the channel is in the correct position before and after this method has run. In general, call Persistable.Writer.write(Persistable, FileChannel) from this method.
